article_title: Challenge: Getting naloxone to the people who need it
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox

article_metadata.description: PROVIDENCE — Rhode Island has been on the forefront nationally in drug overdose prevention but hurdles remain over distributing and supplying communities with the life-saving medication that can reverse an opioid overdose.At least 2,800 doses of the opioid antidote naloxone have been distributed throughout Rhode Island during the last 1½ years. But another 800 doses bought by the state in 2014 have yet to reach the people who need them.Moreover, as demand for naloxone
article_metadata.author: Lynn Arditi
